jobs_results.title: Desarrollador Apps Móviles Ios Y Android
jobs_results.company_name: Sp Human S De Rl De Cv
jobs_results.description:
Desarrollador de apps móviles buscamos para nuestro equipo. Requisitos:
- Ingeniería en sistemas o afín.
- Vivienda en zona de Zopopan.
- Acceso fácil a transporte público.
- Trabajo presencial.
- Creatividad.
Conocimientos:
- Diseño UX/UI.
- Lenguajes HTML5, CSS, SQL.
- Desarrollo de apps móviles y aplicaciones web.
Actividades:
- Creación de páginas en WordPress y/o RD Station.
- Creación de pasarelas de pago o landing page.
Ofrecemos:
- Sueldo mensual de $15,000.
- Prestaciones de ley.
- Horario de lunes a viernes de 8:00 a 5:30.
- Turno de 8 horas.
- Uniformes gratuitos.
- Caja de ahorro.

jobs_results.title: Senior Mobile Software Engineer - Brillio
jobs_results.description:
About the Role

Brillio, a digital technology service provider, is seeking an experienced Senior Mobile Software Engineer to join its team. This role will involve developing software at scale, leading teams, and managing technical projects.

Key Responsibilities
• Design and develop mobile software applications using Swift, Objective-C, and iOS SDK.
• Lead teams, mentor colleagues, and manage technical projects to ensure timely delivery of high-quality products.
• Collaborate with designers, product managers, and backend engineers to drive mobile product and design life cycles.
• Ensure code quality, performance, and security by applying best practices and adhering to coding standards.
• Work closely with stakeholders to understand requirements and set expectations.

Requirements
• 5+ years of experience as a software engineer in the tech industry building products at scale.
• Strong programming skills and up-to-date knowledge of Swift, Objective-C, and iOS SDK.
• Deep understanding of UIKit, Combine, Redux, and SwiftUI.
• Experience leading teams, mentoring colleagues, and managing technical projects.
• Familiarity with mobile product and design life cycles.

What We Offer
• A competitive salary: $120,000 - $180,000 per year, depending on experience.
• Opportunities for professional growth and development.
• A collaborative and dynamic work environment.
• A comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement savings plan, and paid time off.

About Us

Brillio is a partner of choice for many Fortune 1000 companies, helping them turn disruption into a competitive advantage through innovative digital adoption. Our world-class professionals, known as 'Brillians,' distinguish themselves through their capacity to seamlessly integrate cutting-edge digital and design thinking skills with an unwavering dedication to client satisfaction.

Equal Employment Opportunity Declaration

jobs_results.title: Xamarin Forms Developer
jobs_results.description:
Xamarin Forms Mobile (Android/iOS) Developer

We are seeking an experienced, product-oriented Mobile (Android/iOS) developer to join our software engineering team and ensure a superior client experience.

This involves tasks such as building new APIs, enhancing our consumer dashboard, and improving performance and maintainability of our code base.

This is a unique opportunity to join a growing team focused on enhancing the digital banking experience for our consumers and small business customers.
Duties:
• Knowledgeable with iOS and Android development cycle
• Analyze, design, implement, and integrate functional requirements in new/existing solutions
• Work closely with analysts, designers, and team members to achieve project & organizational objectives
• Produce detailed specifications and write efficient program codes
• Test products in controlled, real situations before going live
• Deliver fully tested source code complying with code quality standards
• Maintain systems once they are up and running
• Daily reporting - Collaborate, learn, teach
Skills Required:
• Knowledge of cross-platform mobile app development on iOS or Android
• 5+ years' API development (preferably using .NET Core)
• 5+ years' front-end development (preferably using AngularJS/Angular 10)
• Solid understanding of OOP concepts and design patterns
• API design, implementation, and integration
• Version control systems (Git, SVN, etc.)
• Deployment Systems (Docker, Pipelines)
• Background processing
• Test-driven development (Moq, XUnit or similar)
• Agile/SCRUM methodology
• Strong sense of ownership and pride in the products you will be building
• Self-motivated and able to work independently and as a team member
Preferred:
• Bachelor's degree in STEM or related field
• Financial services industry experience
Benefits:
• Salary: estimated $100,000 per year, paid bi-weekly
• Fund Tax Free Savings for 7% of basic salary
• Major Medical Expenses for you and your Family
• Food Stamps for 5% of basic salary
• Vacation Bonus: 30% of the days to enjoy
• Vacation as established by law
• Christmas Bonus: Food Stamps Aid and Daily attendance award
• Benefits in kind: Life insurance, Funeral expenses insurance, Funeral Support, Leave with pay for childbirth, marriage, death of parents, children, in-laws or siblings
